title: Taliban ’do not see women as human’, says Malala
byline: Malala Yousafzai has urged Muslim leaders to challenge the Taliban government in Afghanistan and its repressive policies for girls and women.

title: Vehicle taxes may rise up to 600 percent in some cases, by 400 - 500 percent in others: Importers
byline: The taxes on vehicles may increase by up to 600 in some cases and some vehicles being subject to taxes as high as 400% or 500%, the Vehicle Importers Association of Sri Lanka (VIASL) said.

title: Motorist with rare diabetic condition seeks justice
byline: In a bizarre turn of events a motorist who is suffering from a rare diabetic condition has been falsely convicted in a breathalyzer test that became positive at the Kirindiwela Police is seeking justice as he had not touched alcohol for the past ten days at the time of the arrest, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: LA fires death toll rises to 24 as high winds expected
byline: Weather forecasters in California are warning fierce winds which fuelled the infernos around Los Angeles are expected to pick up again this week, as fire crews on the ground race to make progress controlling three wildfires.

title: 13 reservoirs start spilling due to high rainfall
byline: A total of 13 reservoirs have started spilling due to high rainfall in the catchment areas, the Water Management Branch of the Irrigation Department reported.

title: Duminda Silva admitted to Prisons Hospital again
byline: Death row inmate Duminda Silva has been admitted to the Prisons Hospital, the Prisons Department said.

title: SLAF rakes over Rs. 56 Mn, providing Air transport to Presidential candidates
byline: The Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) reported earning over Rs. 56 million by providing air transport services to presidential candidates during the 2024 election campaign.

title: Tamarind shortage drives price to Rs. 2,000 per kilogram
byline: A shortage of tamarind in the local market has caused the retail price to soar above Rs. 2,000 per kilogram in the Hatton area, sellers said.

title: Main suspect in Gampola abduction arrested with girl in Ampara
byline: The main suspect in the abduction of a girl from Gampola has been arrested alongside the victim in the Ampara area, police said.

title: Surge in youth mental health challenges and suicide spark concern
byline: The increasing rates of mental health challenges and suicide among young people have raised urgent concerns, demanding immediate action and intervention from parents, educators and healthcare professionals.

title: President Dissanayake to leave for China today
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is set to depart the country this evening (13) for a four-day state visit to the People’s Republic of China.

title: LA fires death toll rises to 24 as high winds expected
byline: Weather forecasters in California are warning fierce winds which fuelled the infernos around Los Angeles are expected to pick up again this week, as fire crews on the ground race to make progress controlling three wildfires.

title: Govt mulls countrywide restrictions on private tuition by school teachers
byline: In the wake of reports about term test papers getting leaked , the Education Ministry mulls the introduction of certain restrictions on school teachers involved in giving private tuition, an official said.

title: Taliban ’do not see women as human’, says Malala
byline: Malala Yousafzai has urged Muslim leaders to challenge the Taliban government in Afghanistan and its repressive policies for girls and women.

title: Govt. makes Hindu devotees switch to Korra or Nadu for pongal rice: JPP
byline: Although Hindu devotees traditionally celebrated the Thai Pongal festival during previous years by preparing Pongal rice with red rice, this year they have to celebrate it by using Korra rice or Nadu rice, Jathika Paribhogika Peramuna (JPP) president, Asela Sampath said.

title: CPJ, partners urge President to protect press freedom
byline: The Committee to Protect Journalists on Monday, January 13 joined 24 civil society organizations in urging recently elected Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake to uphold press freedom.

title: Woman arrested for attempting to smuggle e-cigarettes at BIA
byline: A 32 years old woman was arrested yesterday for smuggling foreign electronic cigarettes (e-cigarettes) worth Rs.6 million at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) by officers attached to the Police Narcotics Division.

title: Government prioritises establishment of additional laboratories for medicine testing
byline: The government is prioritising the establishment of additional laboratories needed for medicine testing, the Health Ministry and Mass Media Secretary, Dr. Anil Jasinghe said.
